intro: Olsynium nicolae, commonly known as the Nicolae's olsynium, is a rare and lesser-known flowering plant species. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It is native to specific regions in southern Europe and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Olsynium nicolae is considered a vulnerable species.
